isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - NINE- AND TEN-SPEED TRANSMISSIONS

svcsubproc.title: 6.10.1. Auxiliary

step1.para: Disconnect and mark the air lines (Figure 39).

figure.caption: Figure 39. Remove Auxiliary On Nine- and Ten-Speed Transmissions

note.para: The auxiliary case must be in the LO range so that the case can be removed.

step1.para: Use an air gun to apply air pressure to the LO range port in the piston housing to put the auxiliary case into the LO range. If necessary, rotate the output shaft while applying air pressure (Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Put Auxiliary Case In LO Range

step1.para: Gear driven speedometers: remove the driven gear from the output bearing retainer and the drive gear from the output shaft.
Electronic speedometers: remove the sensor from the output bearing retainer and the rotor from the output shaft or disconnect the sensor at the connector.
Remove the mounting bolts and washers from the covers of the auxiliary countershafts. Remove the covers. Use a scraper to remove the gasket material on the cover and the case.

caution.para: Install holding cover plates or lift brackets on each auxiliary countershaft. If not used, the countershafts will fall when the auxiliary cover is removed.

step1.para: Install holding cover plates on each countershaft ( Figure 41).

note.para: One or two holes for the holding cover plate may be in the top of the countershaft.
The holding cover plate template is found in SPECIFICATIONS section.

svcsubproc.para: On Design Level 2 Transmissions only, install two lifting brackets and two bolts on each auxiliary countershaft, install the brackets opposite each other as shown in Figure 42.

step1.para: Clean the dowel pins. Remove paint, rust and dirt from the pins so that the auxiliary case can be removed. Lubricate the dowel pins with new oil that is used in the transmission.
Make sure the dowel pins are not damaged. Replace damaged dowel pins after the auxiliary case is removed.
Remove the mounting bolts and washers from the auxiliary case.

Clean the puller holes in the auxiliary case. Install a 3/8 inch - 16 x 1-1/2 inch UNC bolt into the three puller holes. Evenly tighten each bolt to separate the auxiliary case from the transmission case (Figure 43).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Install Bolts Into Puller Holes

warning.para: When using a hammer and steel drift, wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. Do not use tools that are worn or damaged (mushroomed). If the tools are not in safe condition, pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

svcsubproc.para: If the auxiliary case is difficult to remove or the dowel pins are damaged, use a hammer and steel drift to remove one or both of the pins from the main case. Drive the pins toward the yoke. Make sure the case is secure when the pins are removed.

step1.para: Remove the puller screws from the auxiliary case.
Use an overhead hoist and brackets (Figure 44) or a transmission jack and a bracket to remove the auxiliary case from the transmission case.
